fields.title: The DORC
fields.description: One of the personal projects I coded in Python programing language during shelter-in-place.  Gives new meaning to the phrase, "I made a new friend!"  ;-)  The Digital ORaCle (DORC) takes typed or spoken questions, does web scraping to answer, and speaks back utilizing any of 3 open-source voice synthesizers.  DORC can utilize 2 different GUI's to interact with the user visually.
fields.technology: Python, Speech Recognition/Synthesis, Web Scraping, gTTS/pyttsx3/espeak, PySimpleGUI/wxPython

fields.title: Front-End SmartMeter Data Web App
fields.description:
Coded in a couple days: As part of the interview process, a Smart Grid company gave me 2 months of Smart Meter Data and asked me to write a web application to display their data in a way that would be intuitive for their customers, in any browser. It was a "take home" project, for which they gave me a couple days to complete.

Please see "Info" button in the App for Code Critique and further App Details.
fields.technology: Responsive UI Design, Object-Oriented JavaScript (hand-coded, un-minimized and commented by request), JSON, HTML/CSS

fields.title: Back-End Web Search App
fields.description: Coded in a few hours: Back-end Web Application to demonstrate solid, "production-ready" software engineering practices (well-structured, maintainable, modular, secure, and well-commented code)
fields.technology: Object-Oriented PHP, MySQL, MVC, Web Scraping, HTML/CSS

fields.title: Yahoo! Front Page
fields.description:
Non-tech creatives who don't necessarily know HTML, CSS, etc. (both internal employees and chosen vendors) use this application to create content/modules for use on Yahoo!'s US Front Page -- the most trafficked page on the internet at that time.

This Web App was coded by hand from start to finish. It has a built-in, real-time preview system for both the module being developed, and how the current Front Page (at www.yahoo.com) will look when the new module is added. An integrated Help/FAQ system is also built in. At time of completion, this internal tool was also already planned for use by Yahoo!'s Argentina, Mexico, Singapore, and Telemundo Front Pages, as well as by other groups with pages subordinate to both the US Front Page and some of the foreign Yahoo! Front Pages.
fields.technology: Object-Oriented PHP, Object-Oriented JavaScript, AJAX/JSON, MySQL DBs, Object Relational Mapping (ORM), Yahoo! User Interface (YUI) open-source JavaScript and CSS libraries, XHTML/CSS, and XML/XSLT templates on Unix/Linux/CVS platforms

fields.title: Altera Corporate Website Redesign
fields.description: Development and management of separate websites for US, Japan and China, as well as secure and non-secure domains for each of those sites (6 total sites, each with hundreds of thousands of users per day).  Each site featured geo-specific videos by location of country or groups of countries (eg, European-only countries), integrated podcasts and press releases as animated news feeds, social media, etc.  State-of-the-art at that time, these features exceeded internal- and customer- generated targets for customer support and satisfaction, and modernized Altera's web presence and services.
fields.technology: End-to-end development in Java, JavaScript, Flash, HTML/CSS.  Significant back-end, infrastructure programming (Perl, Java) to interface with existing CMS and other internal legacy processes, and provide a smooth and flexible path for robust upward expansion.

fields.title: Altera DevOps: Corporate Web Server Management Application
fields.description:
Allows team's developers and non-programmers to update important configuration files on various Altera private (development) and public (production) web servers via a simple web interface. Changes are verified in a safe, virtual environment before touching the official server files. Then, the config files on multiple development and production servers are updated and reloaded with the verified changes applied, all with a couple mouse clicks. A log of which users made which changes is created, with hooks to automate backing out of these changes is problems are encountered.

This DevOps tool eliminated corporate website downtime due to human error - a crucial 15% reduction! It also reduced time & effort spent by Online Marketing group on server management by about 1200%!
(Previously, 4 different config files on 3 different servers - 12 files total - would need to be hand-edited, manually verified, and manually uploaded to the proper servers, one at a time. Then, each server would need to be manually restarted to load the new changes.)
fields.technology:
Java, HTML5/CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, and Apache web server, with integrated help and documentation for both users and developers.

This tool was my idea: The team had suffered with this problem for years, since nobody believed a tool of this sort was technically feasible within the existing infrastructure (let alone safe). As such, it required diligent lobbying with management for the project's approval, as well as some innovative technical back-flips.

fields.title: DevOps Tool: Partial UI for Web Server Management
fields.description: Facilitates updates to various private (development) and public (production) web server configuration files, validation for correctness and security exposures, logging and backing out of changes, as well as automated restarting of servers to load the validated updates.

fields.title: DevOps Tool: Full UI for Web Server Management
fields.description: Facilitates updates to various private (development) and public (production) web server configuration files, validation for correctness and security exposures, logging and backing out of changes, as well as automated restarting of servers to load the validated updates.

The videos, and the news feeds that cycle in the "What's New?" area, are easily updated by non-tech folks in Corporate Marketing (internal portal provided).

fields.title: Integrated User Docs w/screen-shot from live tool: Content Editing or RSS Feed Selection
fields.description: Once template is selected as a starting point for the look/feel of a new module, the content can be changed to meet the creator's desires.  Content can also be set to come from live RSS/XML feeds (selectable via the drop-down).

fields.title: Free-Form, WYSIWYG Editor with Live Preview (Spanish Template)
fields.description: Creatives can also design modules/templates from scratch, using an integrated, MS-Word-like, WYSIWYG free-form editor, with Live Preview.  This Spanish module is for Argentina's Front Page.

fields.title: User Docs, w/screen-shot from live tool: Save/Export Options
